text: Also why do people keep thinking RCs is not garbage collection?

elements.text: Also why do people keep thinking RCs is not garbage collection?

text: it appears now for me as well, not when Stefan posted the link though

elements.text: it appears now for me as well, not when Stefan posted the link though

text: Also the Java Shenandoah and Z3 Garbage Collectors are cool, but there's not a law of physics we can't get a better collector either - We can eventually call out to Multithreaded ImmixRC and get all the bonuses.

elements.text: Also the Java Shenandoah and Z3 Garbage Collectors are cool, but there's not a law of physics we can't get a better collector either - We can eventually call out to Multithreaded ImmixRC and get all the bonuses.

text:
Also if they REALLY wanted the best possible GC for persistent data structures they'd look at the "functional but in place" Perseus GC that Lean4/Koka have - Lean actually has a 10x implementation vs C++ of red black trees because it can determine when copying is benefitial at the type level.
Receipts: <https://github.com/koka-lang/koka#Benchmarks>
